attributes.description: This map will follow where Orville Redenbacher popcorn goes from production to distribution.
attributes.title: Orville Redenbacher Popcorn

attributes.description: After I recycled this box at USI, it is picked up by the Physical Plant, presorted and sent to Tri-State Resource Recovery. After arriving here, it is recycled.
attributes.title: 1511 Harriet St. Evansville, IN 47710

attributes.description: The popcorn is trucked here using semis and delivered to the Walmart on Red Bank Rd. I bought the popcorn here and took it home to enjoy it's buttery deliciousness.
attributes.address: N Red Bank Rd, Evansville, IN 47712, USA
attributes.title: Red Bank Rd Evansville, IN 47712

attributes.description: This is where Orville Redenbacher popcorn in produced and distributed by ConAgra Foods. They have a popcorn plant in this town that handles most of the demand of the company. The resources that are used are popcorn kernels, canola oil, paper to make the bags, and cardboard to make the boxes the corn comes in.
attributes.title: Rensselaer, IN

attributes.description: This is the location of the Walmart where I bought my box of single-serve kettle korn popcorn.
attributes.title: Rensselaer, IN to Red Bank Rd Evansville, IN 47712
Red Bank Rd Evansville, IN 47712 to 1511 Harriet St. Evansville, IN 47710
